items.title: Toy shortages are in the pipeline as U.S. firms cancel orders with tariffs putting Christmas ‘at risk’
items.description: According to a recent survey from the Toy Association, 80% of mid-sized companies and 64% of small companies are canceling orders.

items.title: Warren Buffett could finally address Trump’s tariffs at Berkshire Hathaway’s annual meeting. Here’s how to watch for free – and without cable.
items.description: The Oracle of Omaha breaks his silence.

items.title: Grand Theft Auto VI, the expected biggest gaming event of the year, is delayed until May 2026
items.description: Shares of publisher Take-Two Interactive Software take a dive.

items.title: PPG CEO says company is ready to navigate Trump tariff uncertainty: ‘Our top 30 suppliers for our U.S. businesses, 0 of them are Chinese’
items.description: PPG reported net sales of $3.68 billion for the quarter, a 4% decline from the year prior, impacted by foreign exchange rates and recent divestitures.

items.title: Japan’s historic work ethic is declining—45% of workers admit they’re quiet quitting
items.description: Workers said they do the basics required for their jobs for various reasons, but cite wanting a better work-life balance.
